subject: Languages
title: Why Italian Sounds Like Music
description: A quick win: understand Why Italian Sounds Like Music.

hook.text: Italian is called the most musical language on Earth. That reputation isn't an accident.

buildup.text: Almost every Italian word ends in a vowel, creating a natural rhythm and flow.

discovery.text: Opera was born in Italy partly because Italian's open vowels project beautifully in theaters.

twist.text: Musical terms worldwide are Italian â€” 'piano,' 'forte,' 'tempo,' 'crescendo,' 'soprano.'

climax.text: Italian became the universal language of music, just as Latin was the language of law.

punchline.text: Every orchestra in the world still takes its instructions in Italian.

quiz.question: Why is Italian considered especially musical?
options: Most words end in vowels, creating natural rhythm
Italian has more words for music
Italian was designed to be musical
